concise_definition: adj. 清醒的, 冷静的, 严肃的; v. 使清醒

definitions.explanation_en: Not under the influence of alcohol or drugs; mentally clear and in full control of one's faculties.
definitions.explanation_cn: 未受酒精或药物影响；头脑清醒，完全掌控自己的思维和行为能力。
definitions.example_en: He stayed sober throughout the party to drive everyone home safely.
definitions.example_cn: 他整晚都保持清醒，以便安全地送每个人回家。

definitions.explanation_en: Serious, calm, and not extravagant or emotional; characterized by restraint and practicality.
definitions.explanation_cn: 严肃、冷静，不奢华或情绪化；表现出克制和务实的特质。
definitions.example_en: She gave a sober assessment of the economic situation, avoiding hype or panic.
definitions.example_cn: 她对经济形势作出了冷静的评估，避免了夸大或恐慌。

definitions.explanation_en: Dull or lacking bright colors; muted in tone or style.
definitions.explanation_cn: 色调暗淡、缺乏鲜艳色彩；风格朴素低调。
definitions.example_en: The room was decorated in sober shades of gray and navy.
definitions.example_cn: 房间以灰蓝等素雅色调装饰。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone to become less intoxicated or to regain mental clarity after drinking alcohol.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人从醉酒状态中清醒过来，恢复理智。
definitions.example_en: A cold shower helped sober him up after the long night of drinking.
definitions.example_cn: 洗了个冷水澡帮助他在通宵饮酒后清醒过来。

comparison.analysis: “Drunk”（醉酒的）是 “sober” 的直接反义词，强调因酒精导致的意识模糊和行为失控。而 “sober” 不仅指生理上的清醒，还常引申为心理和态度上的理性与克制。
“Serious”（严肃的）与 “sober” 在描述态度时有重叠，但 “serious” 更侧重于态度的庄重或重要性，不一定包含冷静或节制的含义。而 “sober” 隐含着情绪上的克制和现实主义，常带有道德或审慎的色彩。
“Modest”（谦逊的/朴素的）与 “sober” 在描述风格时相似，如服装或装饰的朴素。但 “modest” 强调谦虚、不张扬，而 “sober” 更强调色调的暗淡、风格的克制，有时甚至带有压抑或缺乏活力的负面含义。
